turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Malakas.
turn.2: Malakas  Malakas ( ) is a commonly used profane Greek slang word, with a variety of different meanings, but literally meaning "man who masturbates".
turn.4: While it is typically used as an insult, with its literal equivalent in English being "wanker", the meaning varies depending on the tone and context used.
turn.5: What else is it used for?
turn.6: It can be an exclamation of pleasure, an expression of dark horror, a cry of anger, a declaration of affection, and other different things.
turn.8: Common alternative meanings include "asshole", "motherfucker" "jerk" or "idiot", and the contrasting "dude", or "mate", depending on the context.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: It has been described as "the most used Greek slang word"  "Malakas" derives from the Greek word "malakos" (), which means "soft" or "spoilt, well-used to luxuries of life".
turn.11: Is it used by anyone else?
turn.12: It is one of the most frequent words picked up by tourists (often in its vocative case form, i.e. "malaka" ) and travelers to Greece and is not unusual among the younger Greek diaspora, even when the level of Greek is low.
